content: the natica cowl is knitted in the round and then joined end to end to form a double layer of warm silky texture two sections joined by a lateral braid repeat along the cowl making a long loop that twists around the neck twice this a great beginner project for learning some skills beyond stockinette knitting in the round makes it a simple construction and the regular lace sections give it some interest the lateral braids are easy to achieve after some practice and give it a lovely finish irish artisan yarns 4 ply 70% baby alpaca 30% silk 100g - 400m colour a 1 skein natural colour b 1 skein mizen-head one size 120cm length joined into a circle 40cm tube circumference once the sections have been established more or fewer can be put together to customise the length of this cowl it is designed to have 8 sections that totals 120cm in length this alpaca/silk blend by irish artisan yarns is truly divine but if your budget won t allow it then fear not this pattern would suit any of the irish artisan yarns 4plys
